request_pathways.name: HMH Authorization to Use or Disclose PHI (CMR-003, English)
HMH Authorization to Use or Disclose PHI (CMR-003S, Spanish)
Fax to Bayshore Medical Center HIM (732-888-7332)

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (Medical Group / outpatient, dated 2018)
ROI authorization form (Pascack Valley sister facility, image-only scan)
Request for amendment of protected health information
Patient access request form (Pascack Valley sister facility)
ROI authorization form (CMR-003, primary English hospital-level form)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients are directed to a Swellbox/Datavant online wizard from the HMH Medical Records page; the PDF fallback is a generic authorization form requiring patients to name themselves as the recipient.

red_flags: No submission instructions on the ROI form itself
English PDF form not linked from Medical Records page
bright_spots: EHI Export option for machine-readable records uploadable to another EHR
Spanish companion form (CMR-003S) with identical structure and EHI Export
Comprehensive HIM contact directory for all 11 campuses
Granular sensitive-record consent categories (reproductive health, STDs, HIV/AIDS, mental health, substance abuse)

findability.rationale: Level 3: The Swellbox portal is reachable from Bayshore's sub-page via the HMH Medical Records page with moderate navigation, but the English PDF is not linked and required web search to locate.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The Swellbox/Datavant portal provides a fully digital primary pathway; the PDF fallback has zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite, but fax submission is available.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: The CMR-003 form is logically organized with good record-type granularity (11 categories) and delivery options, but uses third-party-release framing confusing for patient self-access, lacks submission instructions, and includes dense legal language in sensitive-record and minor-consent sections.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: The online portal serves as a patient-focused primary pathway, and the PDF includes 'Personal use' as a purpose option plus the rare EHI Export feature; however, the PDF form is designed around third-party disclosure with no dedicated patient-access pathway.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No unreasonable barriers exist; appropriate voluntary and revocation language, granular sensitive-record consent under 42 CFR Part 2, and no notarization or in-person requirements; minor issues include vague fee disclosure and absent submission instructions.

overall.summary: Bayshore Medical Center offers a moderately patient-friendly experience anchored by a Swellbox/Datavant digital portal and a PDF form with progressive features like EHI Export and Spanish availability, held back by poor English PDF discoverability, non-fillable fields, and generic third-party authorization framing.
